page.title: 16HOSPITAL
page.content: {WINESTEAD HOSPITAL} Winestead Hall Hospital for the mentally handicapped, set in 60 acres is built on the site of Old Red Hall. The stable block of Red Hall, built in 1792, was retained and converted into Administration Offices. The hospital has capacity for 115 patients in 6 wards. In 1985, 99 male patients were in residence classed sub-normal, severely sub-normal and epileptic. Ages range from 20 to 80 years; the longest residency being 46 years. The catchment area served is the East Ridings and Hull although some patients are from Huddersfield, Birmingham and Leeds. 85 Full time nursing staff, 29 domestics, 2 porters, 4 sewing room staff, 3 gardeners, 3 drivers, 10 kitchen staff,6 occupational therapists and 4 office staff are employed.
